[13] It is common ground that the initial appeal was made by the Appellant
to the Board of Review in terms of the provisions of the Inland Revenue
Act, No. 38 of 2000, and in terms of proviso to Section 10 of the Tax Appeals
Commission Act, No. 23 of 2011, all appeals pending before the Board of
Review were deemed to stand transferred to the Tax Appeals Commission.
Section 10 of the Tax Appeals Commission Act, No. 23 of 2011, stipulated
that the Tax Appeals Commission shall make the determination within a

column1: period  of  one  hundred  and  eighty  days
